offside.description: A player is in an offside position if they are nearer to the opponents' goal line than both the ball and the second-last opponent.
criteria: Player position relative to second-last opponent
Player position relative to goal line
exceptions: Player is in their own half
Player receives the ball directly from a goal kick, corner kick, or throw-in

foul.description: A foul is an unfair act by a player that interferes with the active play of the game.

types.name: Direct Free Kick Fouls
examples: Kicking or attempting to kick an opponent
Tripping or attempting to trip an opponent
Striking or attempting to strike an opponent

types.name: Indirect Free Kick Fouls
examples: Impeding the progress of an opponent
Preventing the goalkeeper from releasing the ball
Committing any other offense not previously mentioned

handball.description: It is an offense if a player deliberately touches the ball with their hand/arm.
criteria: Deliberate movement of hand/arm towards the ball
Hand/arm position in relation to body movement
exceptions: Ball touches hand/arm directly from player's own head/body/foot
Ball touches hand/arm of player in natural position
Ball touches hand/arm of player falling to ground

goal.description: A goal is scored when the whole of the ball passes over the goal line, between the goalposts and under the crossbar.
criteria: No infringement of Laws of the Game
